plugins.name: IcoSun
plugins.description:
What is Icosun?

Icosun is an open sourced replacement for Icomoon. Its a tool that allows you to convert SVG icons into web fonts. It ensures icons are scalable, accessible, and efficient for web and app development


What does the plugin export?

  1. Source SVGs - A folder containing all raw SVGs used to generate the font files. Ideal for mobile tech stacks that don't support font files as an icon input.
  2. JSON Unicode Map - A key-value mapping between icon names and the unicode values, making it easy to reference icons in your code.
  3. TypeScript Unicode Map - A TypeScript constant that maps SVGs to their unicode representations, allowing direct usage in TypeScript projects.
  4. Combined SVG - A merged single SVG file that links path data to the unicode values, providing a visual reference for your font set.
  5. Font Files - IcoSun generates all major font file formats, ensuring compatibility across different platforms. It outputs TTF, EOT, OTF, WOFF and WOFF2.


What makes IcoSun different?

  1. Duplicate Prevention - IcoSun detects duplicate icons and warns you before export, reducing manual errors in large icon sets.
  2. Simulate Output - SVG-to-font conversion often faces path-winding issues, leading to incorrect subtractions. With IcoSun, you can preview the final output inside Figma before exporting, minimizing unexpected rendering issues.


IcoSun is fully open source, feel free to make changes to the logic as you like üòÄ
plugins.tagline: Generet font file for your icon library

plugins.name: Athlon TOC
plugins.description:
Navigate Your Figma Projects Like Never Before


A tool to streamline your design workflow. This powerful plugin automatically generates a detailed table of contents for your Figma files, making navigation through complex projects a breeze.


Features and Benefits:


Automatic Detection: The tool scans your Figma file and automatically identifies all sections and frames, organizing them into a clear, concise table of contents.


Clickable Links: Each entry in the table of contents is a clickable link, allowing you to jump directly to the relevant section or frame. No more scrolling through endless layers to find what you need!


Dynamic Updates: As your project evolves, rerunning the tool dynamically updates the table of contents to reflect changes, ensuring that you always have an up-to-date overview.


Vertical Auto-Layout: The table of contents is presented in a neatly organized vertical auto-layout frame, providing a clear and structured overview of your document.


Customizable Layout: While the tool takes care of the heavy lifting, you retain full control over the layout and presentation of your table of contents, ensuring it complements your design process.


Easy to Use:

Simply install the plugin, run it within your Figma file, and watch as it transforms your workflow, saving you time and effort.
plugins.tagline: Navigate with Ease: Instant Table of Contents for Your Figma Files

plugins.name: Chameleon
plugins.description:
ü¶é CHAMELEON


Chameleon is a Figma plugin that turns color token management into a breeze. Build smart palettes, structure tokens, and export directly into native Figma Variables.



üé® KEY FEATURES


üé® Smart palette generation ‚Äî create harmonious color ramps from a single base color


üåí Auto dark theme ‚Äî instantly generate dark versions of your palettes


‚ôø A11Y mode ‚Äî contrast-optimized palettes that meet WCAG accessibility standards


üß∑ Figma Variables export ‚Äî full support for collections, modes, and cross-collection aliases


üì§ JSON import/export ‚Äî compatible with Figma Variables and Token Studio


‚úèÔ∏è Flexible structure ‚Äî rename shades, palettes, collections, and modes while preserving links



üåí AUTO DARK THEME


Instantly generate perceptually balanced dark palettes based on your light theme.


How it works:

  1. Inverts brightness scale: lightest shade (50) becomes darkest, darkest (900) becomes lightest
  2. Base color remains at position 500
  3. Brightness follows a perceptual (non-linear) scale
  4. Saturation is increased for dark shades, reduced for light ones
  5. Additional correction ensures visual harmony



üé® BASE MODE


Best for:

  1. Creating aesthetic palettes without strict contrast rules
  2. Branding and accent color systems
  3. Visually balanced UIs with emphasis on artistic control


Generation logic:

  1. Base color is placed at center (shade 500)
  2. Builds out lighter (50‚Äì400) and darker (600‚Äì900) shades
  3. Brightness and saturation adjust relative to the base



‚ôø A11Y MODE


Palettes generated with perceptual brightness, ensuring strong contrast between shades.


Best for:

  1. Interfaces requiring WCAG compliance
  2. Government, medical, educational and fintech products
  3. Inclusive design for wide audiences


Generation logic:

  1. Builds a scale of perceived brightness
  2. Base color is positioned where its brightness fits best
  3. Shades are calibrated for target contrast
  4. Contrast between neighbors ‚â• 1.3:1



üìå HOW TO USE


  1. Create your base palettes in the "Global" tab (5 to 15 shades)
  2. Enable A11Y mode if needed
  3. Switch between light and dark themes to evaluate the result
  4. Export everything to Figma Variables or JSON
  5. Youtube



‚öôÔ∏è UINDER YHE HOOD


  1. HSL-based ramp generation
  2. Edge brightness: Light ‚Äî 95% ‚Üí 20%, Dark ‚Äî 15% ‚Üí 85%
  3. Auto positioning of base color (especially in A11Y mode)
  4. Built-in WCAG contrast checker
  5. Visual base marker (‚òÖ)
  6. Full support for Figma Variables & Token Studio structure



üöß STATUS


This plugin is in beta. We welcome feedback and are actively improving it.
plugins.tagline: Color token generator with automatic shade scales and Figma Variables export

plugins.name: FrameSwapper | Frame to Component
plugins.description:
‚ú®Overview

FrameSwapper is a powerful Figma plugin that helps you replace multiple frames with the same name with a selected component. Perfect for design system implementation and large-scale design updates.


‚ú® Key Features

  1. üîç Smart frame detection: Automatically finds all frames with the same name
  2. üñºÔ∏è Visual preview: Shows thumbnails of both frames and components
  3. ‚ö° Batch replacement: Replace multiple frames at once
  4. üé® Component integrity: Maintains original component dimensions and properties
  5. üîé Search functionality: Quickly find components by name
  6. üì± Clean UI: Modern, intuitive interface


üõ†Ô∏è How It Works

  1. Select any frame in your design
  2. Click "Find Matching Frames" to detect similar frames
  3. Choose which frames to replace (or use "Select All")
  4. Pick a component from the available list
  5. Click "Replace" to transform your frames


üí° Use Cases

  1. Implementing design system components across multiple frames
  2. Updating old designs with new component versions
  3. Standardizing repeated elements across your design
  4. Converting prototype frames into component instances


üÜï Version 1.0.0 Updates

  1. Initial release with core functionality
  2. Smart component replacement system
  3. Visual preview system
  4. Search and filter capabilities
  5. Batch selection and replacement
  6. Modern, user-friendly interface


üí°Resources & Links

Create with Confidence

Make color decisions faster with intelligent tools that understand both aesthetics and accessibility. Every palette you generate comes with semantic color naming and WCAG-compliant text color recommendations, helping you build cohesive design systems that scale beautifully.


Professional-Grade Control

  1. Precisely adjust colors using the perceptually uniform OKLCH space, with familiar HEX, RGB, and HSL options
  2. Create smooth, mathematically accurate gradients that maintain consistent luminance
  3. Generate context-aware color names that adapt to your design system
  4. Ensure accessibility with automatic contrast checking and text color suggestions
  5. Export palettes directly to your design tools and documentation
  6. Spark inspiration with curated random palettes based on color theory principles

üéØ Brand Identity ‚Äì Craft memorable, on-brand color palettes

üì¶ UI Components ‚Äì Ensure color harmony across your interfaces

üì± Digital Products ‚Äì Create accessible, high-impact user experiences

Experience the next evolution in color tools. Chroma UI combines mathematical precision with designer-friendly workflows to help you create better color systems in less time.

plugins.name: Stroke Manager
plugins.description:
Stroke Manager is a powerful Figma plugin that lets you efficiently manage stroke properties across multiple elements simultaneously. Perfect for designers who work with illustrations, icons, wireframes, or any vector content.


Key Features


  1. Batch Update Strokes: Modify stroke width, alignment, and end caps across multiple elements at once
  2. Smart Color Management: Map colors individually or override all strokes with a single color
  3. End Point Styling: Quickly apply different cap styles (round, square, arrow)
  4. Nested Elements: Apply changes to parent elements and all their children with a single click
  5. Color Detection: Intelligently groups similar colors to simplify your workflow


Why You'll Love It

Save valuable time by updating dozens or hundreds of stroke properties in seconds instead of tediously modifying each element individually. Stroke Manager is particularly useful when adapting illustrations for different sizes or contexts, ensuring consistent stroke weights and styles throughout your design.

Perfect for design system maintenance, icon libraries, and illustration collections, Stroke Manager helps you maintain visual consistency while dramatically speeding up your workflow.

plugins.name: Dynamo
plugins.description:
Effortlessly increase design quality and accessibility


  1. Live preview Dynamic Type in real time
  2. Spot where text needs to wrap or truncate
  3. Add your scaled designs to the canvas with a click
  4. Saves you a ton of time


What's Dynamic Type?


Many users set a text size other than the default in order to read content more comfortably. Supporting Dynamic Type and larger text sizes is an important accessibility requirement. Dynamo scales text layers in your designs to test how they handle larger text sizes. Making it much easier to increase the quality, robustness, and inclusivity of your designs.


For best results


  1. Use auto layout in your designs so that layouts remain in tact once text layers have scaled
  2. To ignore a text layer, prepend its name with a period


Please leave comments and feedback below.

plugins.name: Figma to Celtra

  2. Efficient Importing: Easily transition your designs from Figma to Celtra using a simple copy and paste function. Whether you're working with single layers or multiple artboards, the process is quick and hassle-free.
  3. Layer Mapping: Experience seamless compatibility as all layer types from Figma are mapped to their corresponding layers in Celtra. Make configurations effortlessly for Images, Text, Shapes, and Groups right after you import.


Once your designs are in Celtra, take advantage of creative automation to scale your content across various sizes and design variations without missing a beat. Upgrade your design collaboration and scaling capabilities today by using "Figma to Celtra", and take the first step toward a more streamlined creative workflow.

plugins.name: Atomic Design Components
plugins.description:
Transform your design workflow with our AI-powered component generator. Simply describe what you want in natural language, and watch as professional, consistent UI components come to life instantly.


Key Features:

‚Ä¢ Generate complete UI components using simple text prompts

‚Ä¢ Built on atomic design principles for maximum reusability

‚Ä¢ Support for buttons, forms, inputs, navigation, and more

‚Ä¢ Customizable colors, sizes, states, and properties

‚Ä¢ Responsive and design system ready

‚Ä¢ Premium features including unlimited generations


Perfect for design teams, UI/UX designers, and anyone building professional interfaces. Start with our free trial and generate up to 20 components!


Contact & Support:


GitHub Issues: Report bugs or request features on GitHub.


Email Support: Reach out directly at alexanderburgosuk82@gmail.com.

GptToI18n is a very useful plugin tool! Not only can it easily generate i18n with one click, but it can also instantly convert designs into multiple language versions, so that you can easily respond to the global market.


Generate i18n json in one click. This means that you can automatically translate your designs into other languages without having to write any code. This will not only save you time and effort, but also improve your productivity.


We recommend that you finish in draft state, you just need to hold down ctrl + p to open the GptToI18n plugin, select the scope and target language you want to convert, and then click Get JSON, only need to wait a few seconds to complete the i18n JSON generation. The Text name that can be seen is also processed.


If you need to convert your design to the target language version, just click Translate Page from JSON.


Convert design drafts into various languages with one click. No matter where your customers are in the world, they just need to open your design manuscript and instantly understand your product.


Of course, if you do not enter the OpenAi API key, it will cost tokens to get the corresponding JSON, and if you have your own OpenAi API key, then you can use it as much as you like.


So, if you are someone who is good at trying out new tools, then GptToi18n is definitely a good choice not to be missed. It can not only help you save time and effort, improve work efficiency, but also make it easier for your products to enter the global market. Give it a try and let it bring more convenience and success to your work!

‚Ä¢ Automation Ready - CSS-like output perfect for scripts and AI prompts

‚Ä¢ Time Saving - No more element-by-element inspection

‚Ä¢ Developer Friendly - Bridge design tokens to code implementation


üéØ Perfect for teams who:

- Use Tokens Studio for design system management

- Want to automate component development

- Need comprehensive token auditing

- Build design-to-code automation tools


Simply select any element in Dev Mode and get a complete token breakdown ready for your automation workflows.


Requires Figma files with Tokens Studio tokens applied.

plugins.name: Quick Rename
plugins.description:
Automatically renames frames and components in Figma based on their auto-layout properties. It helps designers maintain consistent and meaningful layer naming conventions, making it easier to understand the structure and purpose of elements in complex designs.


Key features


  1. Renames frames with auto-layout to "Column", "Row", or "Wrap" based on their layout mode
  2. Labels frames without auto-layout as "Container"
  3. Identifies frames containing text as "Content"
  4. Rename all shapes as "Vector"
  5. Preserves naming for component instances
  6. Reset text layers names


Benefits


  1. Saves time on manual renaming
  2. Improves file organization and readability
  3. Enhances collaboration by providing clear visual hierarchy
  4. Helps maintain consistency across design systems
  5. Makes it easier to identify and update layout structures
plugins.tagline: Essential keyboard shortcut to rename layers

Whether you‚Äôre working with rectangles, text, or complex auto-layout frames, AutoLayers ensures your layers are consistently named and organized.


With support for multiple selected frames, this plugin helps you keep your Figma files tidy and easy to navigate, saving you time and effort on manual renaming.

plugins.name: Stash Modes
plugins.description: This plugin enables you to "stash" variable modes within your Figma file. A stashed mode is essentially a copy of an existing mode. Although it is not directly accessible for pages and frames, you can later swap it back as a "real" mode. This feature proves handy when you want to experiment with different settings while preserving your original modes.
plugins.tagline: Save variable modes for later
